content: Former police division in Singapore 01°20′23″N 103°51′0″E﻿ / ﻿1.33972°N 103.85000°E﻿ / 1.33972; 103.85000 The **Toa Payoh Police Division** (or **'B' Division**, [Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 大巴窑警区, [Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): Divisyen Polis Toa Payoh) was a former [police division](/wiki/Police_division) of the [Singapore Police Force](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force), operating from 1977 to 1988. ## History First formed in 1950 as the **Kandang Kerbau Police Station** beside the old [KK Hospital](/wiki/Kandang_Kerbau_Women%27s_and_Children%27s_Hospital) building (near the present day *Land Transport Authority, Hampshire Office*) at Kampong Java Road, it was moved to the new **Toa Payoh Police Station** in 1977 and was subsequently renamed 'B' Division, as part of the Singapore government's effort in providing every new town with a police presence. [Toa Payoh Police division](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force#Defunct_Units/Facilities) was closed down in 1988, with its areas of control taken over by [Tanglin Police Division](/wiki/Tanglin_Police_Division) ('E' Division) & [Ang Mo Kio Police Division](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio_Police_Division) ('F' Division), respectively. The station became the Headquarters for the Police [Volunteer Special Constabulary](/wiki/Volunteer_Special_Constabulary) from 1988 until 1994, when Force Communications Branch of the [Police Technology Department](/wiki/Police_Technology_Department) took over the use of the building. The building was vacated again in year 2000 for a major refurbishment before utilisation by the Security Command. - [Toa Payoh ritual murders](/wiki/Toa_Payoh_ritual_murders) - Adrian Lim Murders This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
